definition: to exclaim in admiration/a gasp of surprise
to startle/to be frightened/to be scared/alarm

sentences.english: A lot of Chinese and foreign tourists to see the tree after hanging its amazing beauty repeatedly.
sentences.chinese: 很多中外游客看到树挂后都连声惊叹其美丽。

sentences.english: People in Guangzhou have huge purchasing power.
sentences.chinese: 广州人的购买力更是让人惊叹。

sentences.english: The soundwave-like abstract patterns that Brauer has captured are stunning.
sentences.chinese: 布劳尔掌握的类似声波抽象模式是令人惊叹的。

sentences.english: I have also marveled at XMUP's creativity.
sentences.chinese: 厦大出版社无穷的创造力也令我惊叹。

sentences.english: People gushing on and on about their amazing love life?
sentences.chinese: 有人滔滔不绝地讲述她们那让人惊叹的爱情生活？
我们更惊叹她那动人的发音。

sentences.english: I found myself gasping over the tragedy of the poor people's lives that the play portrayed so well.
sentences.chinese: 我不由惊叹这部戏剧对于穷人苦难生活描写入木三分。

sentences.english: Records of Zheng He's incredible voyages were burned.
sentences.chinese: 郑和令人惊叹的航海纪录也遭焚毁湮灭。

sentences.english: People were all shocked at her godlike beauty.
sentences.chinese: 所有人都惊叹于她天仙般的美貌。

sentences.english: We marveled at the closeness of the design.
sentences.chinese: 我们为设计的严密而惊叹。

sentences.english: As the world-class golf villa, Yunling's outstanding quality is impressive.
sentences.chinese: 作为世界级的高尔夫别墅，云岭的优异品质令人惊叹。

sentences.english: Tonight, I cannot help but marvel at how far we have come together.
sentences.chinese: 今晚，我不禁对双方交往的长足进展感到惊叹。

sentences.english: The temple's most breathtaking feature is a towering pagoda.
sentences.chinese: 庙宇最让人惊叹的地方是一座巍峨的宝塔。

sentences.english: We were so amazed and looked at the paintings one by one.
sentences.chinese: 我们万分惊叹，逐一仔细观看那些名画。

sentences.english: Noda's the second highest number of votes immediately attracted the audience breathless.
sentences.chinese: 野田的这一第二高得票数顿时引来台下的惊叹声。

sentences.english: The world is a stunning place, full of outstanding works of art.
sentences.chinese: 这个世界是令人惊叹的，到处都是让人叹服的艺术品。

definition: to click one's tongue in wonder (idiom)/to be astonished
(idiom) to gasp in amazement/to acclaim as the peak of perfection
to be amazed/to be surprised/to wonder
to cry out in alarm or surprise
to be surprised/to be amazed/to be stunned
to sigh with sorrow, regret etc/rueful/deeply moved
to be startled/to be shocked/to be amazed
to convince/to subdue/to be convinced/to be bowled over
